meanings.definition: Capable of being broken down into simpler substances
meanings.sent1: The degradable paper bag quickly turned into small pieces.
meanings.sent2: The degradable packaging material is environmentally friendly.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left the degradable straw in water, and now it's disappearing!
meanings.sent4: Her degradable smile melted away as she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The degradable leaves on the forest floor were slowly turning into soil.

meanings.definition: Able to be decomposed or disintegrated
meanings.sent1: The degradable fabric started to fall apart after being buried in the soil.
meanings.sent2: It's important to use degradable materials to reduce waste.
meanings.sent3: The degradable soap seemed to vanish into thin air after use.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was degradable, crumbling under the weight of betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The degradable ice sculpture melted under the hot sun, leaving only a puddle.

meanings.sent1: The degradable fruit was starting to rot on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: Old books made of degradable paper can easily fall apart.
meanings.sent3: The degradable fence posts were slowly being eaten away by termites.
meanings.sent4: His degradable memory faded with time, forgetting the details of the event.
meanings.sent5: The degradable building materials were showing signs of wear and tear after years of use.
